content: On June 23, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the New York Mets in a thrilling matchup that showcased the brilliance of pitcher Tom Glavine. Glavine delivered a stellar performance, throwing a complete game and allowing just one run while striking out 11 batters, leading the Braves to a 4-1 victory. This game was a significant moment in the Braves' season, as it helped to establish their dominance in the National League and set the stage for their eventual pennant-winning campaign that year.
